post: Who penned We the People ? Meet Gouverneur Morris, the Constitutions stylist and a major voice at the Philadelphia Convention. Dennis Rasmussen joins BRI to unpack Morriss ideas on Congress, the presidency, and the Preamble. Watch:  https://bit.ly/3IOFlP2  #CivicEducation  #AmericanFounding  #Constitution

⏳ Last chance! The Florida MyImpact Challenge Civics Fair is just days away. Students will showcase community service projects, pitch new ideas, and compete for $2,000 in prizes. Dont miss out, register before its too late:  https://bit.ly/45YV1rx  #FloridaStudents  #MyImpactChallenge  #YouthLeadership  #CivicEducation  #ServiceLearning

Civic Star themes bring civics into any classroom. From Equality  to Revolution & Change,  students discover history and connect it to today, while teachers compete for prizes. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4fOChOR  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #TeachingResources  #America250

Help us congratulate National Civic Teacher of the Year finalist Christian Wrabley (Greater Johnstown HS, PA)! He models civil dialogue, elevates student voice, and turns civics into action, from weekly voting to problem-solving that shapes school policy. 🔗  https://bit.ly/46EAid9  #CivicEducation  #CivilDialogue  #StudentVoice  #Leadership

The Civics Fair is about more than prizes, its about impact. Students will showcase service projects that strengthen communities and pitch ideas to solve real challenges. Join us Oct. 11 at UCF for the Florida MyImpact Challenge. Register today:  https://bit.ly/45YV1rx  #FloridaStudents  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicLeadership  #ServiceLearning  #CommunityImpact

📜  #OTD in 1877, Chief Joseph of the Nez Perce surrendered to U. S. forces after months of resistance. His speech, I will fight no more forever,  remains one of the most powerful in American history. How can we help students understand this moment of loss and resilience? 🔗 Discover this lesson:  https://bit.ly/3KxzyxE  #TDiH  #NativeAmericanHistory  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory

What do you gain from the Florida Civics Fair? ✅ Leadership experience ✅ AP Gov applied civics project credit ✅ Prizes up to $2,000 Students across Florida will showcase their service projects Oct. 11 at UCF. Register:  https://bit.ly/45YV1rx  #FloridaStudents  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicEducation  #ServiceLearning

Meet Veronica Pitts, our 2025–26 National Civics Teacher of the Year. From growing up in a military family to teaching in Selma, she inspires students to see their own power and voice in civic life. Watch her story:  https://bit.ly/48Jya4Y  #CivicEducation  #TeachingMatters  #CivicLeadership

Choose your state. Change a classroom. With Civics Champion, every $1 puts a Pocket Constitution into a students hands, right where civic learning happens. Which state will you back today? Give now:  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #SupportTeachers  #StatePride

How do we prepare students to live out the ideals of liberty, equality, and justice? In this lesson, Theodore Roosevelts call for active citizenship challenges middle schoolers to connect civic duty with constitutional principles. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4mLPvhk  #CivicEducation  #CivicLearning  #StudentEngagement  #America250  #TeachingResources
